How can I replace all occurrences of a specific word in a string with another word in [Python]? 
Input code:
my_str = "The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog"
old_word = "fox"
new_word = "cat"
Data format:
You must have [Python code] data type in the following Rewrite prompt
Solution:
In Python, you can use the replace() method to replace all occurrences of a specific word in a string with another word. Here's an example:
my_str = "The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog"
old_word = "fox"
new_word = "cat"
new_str = my_str.replace(old_word, new_word)
print(new_str)
This will output:
"The quick brown cat jumps over the lazy dog"
Note that the replace() method is case-sensitive, so it will only replace exact matches of the old word. If you want to replace all occurrences regardless of case, you can convert the string to lowercase using the lower() method before calling replace(). For example:
my_str = "The quick brown FOX jumps over the lazy dog"
old_word = "fox"
new_word = "cat"
new_str = my_str.lower().replace(old_word.lower(), new_word)
print(new_str)
This will output:
"The quick brown cat jumps over the lazy dog"

To replace all occurrences of a specific word in a string with another word in Python, you can indeed use the `replace()` method. Below is the complete solution in the format you've requested:

```python
# Initial string
my_str = "The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog"

# Words to replace
old_word = "fox"
new_word = "cat"

# Replace occurrences of old_word with new_word
new_str = my_str.replace(old_word, new_word)

# Print the modified string
print(new_str)
```

This code will output:
```
"The quick brown cat jumps over the lazy dog"
```

If you want to perform a case-insensitive replacement, convert both the string and the word to lowercase before using `replace()`. Here's how you can do it:

```python
# Initial string with mixed case
my_str = "The quick brown FOX jumps over the lazy dog"

# Words to replace with case-insensitivity
old_word = "fox"
new_word = "cat"

# Convert the string to lowercase and replace occurrences
new_str = my_str.lower().replace(old_word.lower(), new_word)

# Print the modified string
print(new_str)
```

This will output:
```
"the quick brown cat jumps over the lazy dog"
```

Please note that converting the entire string to lowercase will change the case of other words as well. If you want to preserve the original case of other words, you might need a more sophisticated approach, such as using regular expressions with the `re` module.
